Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2012 12:36AM angel13 wrote: Hi Leneza You are right about that it changes our lives forever! When I hear someone talking about that they have a cold or flu bug I think to myself..gee what I wouldn't give to be dealing with that instead of this.. Hopefully we both will get good news and look forward to catching the flubug.. Big Hug Andrea
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2012 10:22PM angel13 wrote: Hi Leneza I do scrapbooking and just recently have taken up making homemade liquors and then put them in to little bottles and paint the front of the bottle with my own logo. I normally do not drink but these past few weeks I have taken a sip and it helps for about oh 2 sec.. My husband is going back to work in Saudi next week ..depending on my results so we have been doing things around the island here..lots to do and see..I don't hardly know anyone here because we just moved here but I do volunteer work 1 day week so that really helps. I know what you mean about not telling anyone they do not know where I volunteer and it is a close knit group..and I keep thinking ..and I shouldn't..what if it is bad news then how do you begin to tell people. This will come out of left field for them and for my mother in law and father in law. I just felt that I was doing enough worrying for everyone and did not want to be a bother or a burden. All I would say if any should ask is thank-you for your asking not bad..and I think anyone that knows you will know by your tone of voice and how you say it and then change the subject back to them and How are you doing? Actually it happened today to me and it went very well by me approaaching it like that..Good Luck with that okay. I wish I also had mine also so I can feel a spark of happiness again. When are your results Leneza? Take Care the best you can and A Big Hug Andrea
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2012 02:43PM angel13 wrote: Hi Leneza You are right about that going for a mammography and not to put it off and also if someone else is in the same place and not talking it might bring them out to talk knowing they are not the only ones. There are people that care and are there for each other through it. I live on Vancouver Island..Qualicum Beach/Parksville..so nice but not today..Where are you from? I have not tried digital but I love doing it it sure takes your mind and thoughts to another level. I was suppose to get my results on the 20th but they could not get me in so it is the 24th.They do not give that info on the phone no way no how..I know what you mean about other aches and pains and it is funny how we can prioritze in a heartbeat. Thank-you for letting me know about the Path Report..I will look at that also.. It takes me a long time to fall asleep and it usually ends up in tears and a prayer. How I wish this was a dream but it is very real and we have to try and deal with this the best that we can..and is it easy..no..but we will get through this togeather one way or another. The kids must be a blessing for you they can take one's mind off if only for a while and every bit and every minute helps. My fingers crossed for you and you know I will be thinking about you! Hugs Andrea

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2012 12:50PM angel13 wrote: Hi SueJR My thoughts and prayers are with you! Thinking postive thoughts... Hugs Andrea
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 01:01AM angel13 wrote: Hi Mya I am going tommorow for my strerotactic Core Biopsy and I am so scared but playing tough with those around me. It has been so hard and when I feel like I am going to break down I hold it back and the tears come when I lay my head on the pillow.I got prepared for a full biopsy only to get a call that it had been cancelled due to..and yes you heard this right..no radiologist in the hospital. So my surgeon had to change his plans to get me to another hospital ..which I am grateful for but in the meantime you try to prepare the best that you can and then poof it gone..The results here take 7-10 days and that is going to be very hard to try and get through. We just moved here and have 1 friend but I am the type of person that does not want to burden anyone with my health issues. I just want to say thank-you to all of you for sharing your stories it has made it a wee bit easier to get through and I know it is not the same to what we are going through but I would be very happy to be your buddy.. Hugs to you!
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 08:39PM angel13 wrote: Hi Sue Sorry my computer is acting up..anyways they managed to get the first clump of calcifications and it was over. I have to wait  10 days now and I will let you know how it goes..shortage of pathologist's.... When I got home the tears just flowed like turning on a water tap..I guess it was all I was holding in. I guess I all of us can ask for a buddy it helps having this group that can relate to what each other is going through and to be there for each other. Always in my heart..Good Luck to you on Friday. Andrea

Posts.Content: Jan 17, 2012 06:06PM angel13 wrote: Hi Smiley I am glad you mentioned that about what the radiologist had said..I was to afraid to ask or talk about it..Here for each other if you need to chat.. Fingers crossed for all of us! Hugs Andrea

Posts.Content: Jan 12, 2012 05:47PM angel13 wrote: Hi All I am so happy for you Blg..that is great news! I am also glad I found this site  and this group. It has really got me through the days when I was feeling so low and thought..who would understand what I am going through..and at that time I did not think there was anyone but myself. I will be thinking about you Sue and thinking postive thoughts and I say my prayers for everyone that our results turn out to be okay. They have changed my wait time now to Jan 24..not much I can do about that so I am trying to keep busy and my mind occupied..but I do have my moments of tears and anxiety. Hugs to all Andrea
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2012 03:24PM angel13 wrote: Hi Sue Yes you keep on keeping postive! We know that if we let it our minds can play games with us like never imagined. Also I hear you about wanting this all over..I don't know if this happens to you or anyone here but just those few moments when your mind has 1 or 2 minutes piece something cancer related will pop up and....boom back at the worry again. I feel sometimes like a yo yo up and down and then of course thanks to my mind I start looking at other parts of my body if something hurts and I think is that something also...but I am quickley learning to put that the farthest away from my mind otherwise I will need a straight jacket. Besides this wonderful group I have 2 friends that I kinda confide in but in some ways I feel like I am pushing them away like I have done with some of my other friends. It is nice to talk to them but they do not understand what really..we are going through and bless them for trying to care. Does your family know at all Sue? My husband knows but I feel he is either acting like this is a flu/cold and it will be over soon and so I do not talk to him at all only abou this wonderful site I have found and all of you which if we could could not bounce off each other I don't know where I would be right now. Did they say when they plan on getting this done for you? Hopefully the sooner the better. You are in my thoughts and let me know when they have a date and of course chat anytime for support. Hugs and Much Love Andrea

Posts.Content: Jan 19, 2012 06:54PM angel13 wrote: Hi All I was not suppose to get my results until the 24th but my regular doctor bless his heart knew I was waiting on pins and needles...The results are benign and he did not get into the what it was I will have to go on the 24th and find out from the surgeon..but WHOOOOHOOOOO! My mind is still numb and is trying to absorb this great news..I look forward to a good nights sleep and looking at life a wee bit different. Those that are still waiting my prayers are with you ..and you are always in my thoughts. Love Andrea

Posts.Content: Jan 13, 2012 09:33PM angel13 wrote: Hi Sue What a day it has been for you! Could they tell you anything at all or they just want to have a further look? I guess in retrospect better to be safe than sorry..and it sounds like they are being thorough which is a blessing..but I am so sorry you have to wait and go through the anxiety and the worry. But just know that I am here for you anytime..and has we all know the anxiety and wait can get the better of us sometimes but that is what we are all here for is to support and care and love the best that we can.  I guess I can't imagine right now what a day would be like not thinking about this and just having a happy ordinary day and god willing I wish this for all of us! Thanks for letting us know Sue and we will always be waiting buddies with hopeful news for all. Hugs and Love Andrea

Posts.Content: Jan 14, 2012 09:10PM angel13 wrote: Hi Robin When I first was going through waiting for appointments much like yourself..just the shear thought of when are they going to get me in..was enough..then came the biopsy and the I wonder if it will hurt and then now I wait for my results..In the meantime I really needed someone to talk to that would understand how I was feeling and found this wonderful site with waiting buddies that are going through waiting for appoinments to biopsy and results. If you have read some of our stories we are there for each through the waiting and beyond. Wish away Robin..it is a good form of postive thinking..If you need to chat we are here for each other. I hope this answered your question. Hugs Andrea

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2012 09:27PM angel13 wrote: Hi Leneza I am sooooooooo happy for you! It is over for you and what a feeling it must be to wake up tommorow in a new light. Thank-you for the information and Thank-you for checking on me it means a lot. Big Hug Andrea
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2012 01:48PM angel13 wrote: Hi Barb We are all one..and most definitely it sure helps waiting togeather and it is a sick feeling for sure.. and when you wake up to the time you go to bed it is on your mind..and just to have that pit removed..I can understand..please let me know how things turn out for you okay..and thinking about you always. I have to wait until the 20th for my results..I may need a straight jacket by then..but with the help and comfort of this group it really helps.How long Barb did they say you had to keep your bandages on for? They probably told me but I was in another world when I left the hospital. It;s funny when this happens in your life and suddenly everything around you changes also and you just want it to go back to being normal. You just look at life a wee bit differently and want to be like that normal person on the street or at work or shopping..but you can't. The waiting is very hard and I am doing my best to keep my chin up. I hope one day that I can wake up and have a smile on my face that I have lost since June 2011. Anyways you take care Barb and any time you want to talk I am here and we can all comfort each other   and get through this togeather one way or another. Always in my heart Andrea
Posts.Title: NEW: I need a waiting buddy skapaya skapaya

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2012 06:44PM angel13 wrote: Hi Barb I am from Canada and live on Vancouver Island and the medical system here really is in dire need of well..most everything. I phoned today and get my results Jan 24 in person they do not give them over the phone. No I did not ask because my mind was to busy listening to the toothbrush drill and the 2 assistants were so wonderful talking to me about my hometown so we chit chatted a bit about home. I think also in the back of my mind I was afraid to ask to hear the outcome. All she said is I did really good. Thank-you for the bandage info ..yes I have the strips also and the bandage and I was not sure when to take them off..but do now..thanks again. I will be praying for you and thinking postive thoughts. I was just telling a dear friend from back home about this site and how it has made me realize that I am not the only one and I have come to terms with that and now dealing with the results. One minute at a time one step at a time..I finally shut my eyes at 5 this morning so I think I will try and get some rest. Thanks again for your support and prayers for you and a big hug.. Andrea

Any idea when your cat scan is? Everyone is different and that probably helps you when you tell them nothing wrong with that.. and also I am sure they are very caring back.. Hang in there.. Hugs Andrea
